00128 typedef enum _PIZNoteValue {
00129     PIZ_WHOLE_NOTE_DOTTED           = 144,  /*!<  */
00130     PIZ_WHOLE_NOTE                  = 96,   /*!<  */
00131     PIZ_WHOLE_NOTE_TRIPLET          = 64,   /*!<  */
00132     PIZ_HALF_NOTE_DOTTED            = 72,   /*!<  */
00133     PIZ_HALF_NOTE                   = 48,   /*!<  */
00134     PIZ_HALF_NOTE_TRIPLET           = 32,   /*!<  */
00135     PIZ_QUARTER_NOTE_DOTTED         = 36,   /*!<  */
00136     PIZ_QUARTER_NOTE                = 24,   /*!<  */
00137     PIZ_QUARTER_NOTE_TRIPLET        = 16,   /*!<  */
00138     PIZ_EIGHTH_NOTE_DOTTED          = 18,   /*!<  */
00139     PIZ_EIGHTH_NOTE                 = 12,   /*!<  */
00140     PIZ_EIGHTH_NOTE_TRIPLET         = 8,    /*!<  */
00141     PIZ_SIXTEENTH_NOTE_DOTTED       = 9,    /*!<  */
00142     PIZ_SIXTEENTH_NOTE              = 6,    /*!<  */
00143     PIZ_SIXTEENTH_NOTE_TRIPLET      = 4,    /*!<  */
00144     PIZ_THIRTY_SECOND_NOTE          = 3,    /*!<  */
00145     PIZ_THIRTY_SECOND_NOTE_TRIPLET  = 2,    /*!<  */
00146     PIZ_NOTE_NONE                   = 1     /*!<  */
00147     } PIZNoteValue;

00156     PIZ_IONIAN                      =  0,   /*!<  */

00166     PIZ_WHOLE_TONE,                         /*!<  */
00167     PIZ_PENTATONIC_MAJOR,                   /*!<  */
00168     PIZ_PENTATONIC_MINOR,                   /*!<  */
00169     PIZ_OCTATONIC_HALF_WHOLE,               /*!<  */
00170     PIZ_OCTATONIC_WHOLE_HALF,               /*!<  */
00171     PIZ_SEVENTH_MAJOR,                      /*!<  */
00172     PIZ_SEVENTH_DOMINANT,                   /*!<  */
00173     PIZ_SEVENTH_MINOR,                      /*!<  */

00175     PIZ_SEVENTH_MINOR_SIXTH,                /*!<  */

00234 /**
00235  * \ingroup sequenceTypes
00236  */
00237  
00238 typedef enum _PIZAddFlag {
00239     PIZ_ADD_FLAG_NONE       = 0,                    /*!< No flag. */
00240     PIZ_ADD_FLAG_SNAP       = 1,                    /*!< Snap notes to grid. */
00241     PIZ_ADD_FLAG_PATTERN    = 2,                    /*!< Snap notes to pattern. */
00242     PIZ_ADD_FLAG_AMBITUS    = 4,                    /*!< Transpose notes to zone's ambitus. */
00243     PIZ_ADD_FLAG_CLIP       = 8,                    /*!< Restrict notes to zone. */
00244     PIZ_ADD_FLAG_UNSELECT   = 16,                   /*!< Force notes unselected/unmarked. */
00245     PIZ_ADD_FLAG_CLEAR      = 32,                   /*!< Clear sequence before. */
00246     } PIZAddFlag;

00251 /**
00252  * \details Note. 
00253  * \ingroup sequenceTypes
00254  */
00255  
00256 typedef struct _PIZNote {
00257     long    flags;                                  /* Various flags as bit field. */
00258     long    data[4];                                /* MIDI values. */
00259     long    isSelected;                             /* True if the note is selected. */
00260     long    position;                               /* Position of the note. */
00261     long    tag;                                    /* Label (unique) of the note. */
00262     } PIZNote;
00263 
00264 /**
00265  * \details Sequence.  
00266  * \ingroup sequenceTypes
00267  */
00268  
00269 typedef struct _PIZSequence {
00270     pthread_mutex_t     lock;                       /* POSIX mutex. */
00271     long                *values1;                   /* Private for temporary storage. */
00272     long                *values2;                   /* Private for temporary storage. */
00273     PIZNote             **notes1;                   /* Private for temporary storage. */
00274     PIZNote             **notes2;                   /* Private for temporary storage. */
00275     PIZBoundedHashTable *hashTable;                 /* Private for temporary storage. */
00276     PIZLinklist         **timeline;                 /* Sequence as a timeline. */
00277     PIZGrowingArray     *scale;                     /* Mode/scale. */
00278     PIZGrowingArray     *pattern;                   /* Rythmic pattern. */
00279     PIZNote             *markedNote;                /* Pointer to one note in the sequence. */
00280     PIZGrowingArray     *map;                       /* List of timeline's indexes in use. */
00281     long                start;                      /* Zone's start (included). */
00282     long                end;                        /* Zone's end (not included). */
00283     long                down;                       /* Zone's low ambitus (included). */
00284     long                up;                         /* Zone's high ambitus (included). */
00285     long                count;                      /* Number of notes. */
00286     long                index;                      /* Current playback head's index. */
00287     long                chance;                     /* Chance value [0, 100]. */
00288     long                channel;                    /* Global MIDI channel. */
00289     long                velocity;                   /* Global MIDI velocity. */
00290     PIZNoteValue        cell;                       /* Cell for generators. */
00291     PIZNoteValue        grid;                       /* Magnetic grid of the sequence. */
00292     PIZNoteValue        noteValue;                  /* Default note value. */
00293     } PIZSequence;

00310  */
00311 void pizSequenceFree (PIZSequence *x);

00410 void pizSequenceSetNoteValue (PIZSequence *x, PIZNoteValue noteValue);

00412 /**
00413  * \brief   Set the scale of the sequence.
00414  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00415  * \param   key The scale key.
00416  * \param   type The scale type.
00417  * \param   a The scale if the type provided is custom, otherwise should be NULL.
00418  * \remark  An example :  
00419  * \code
00420  *  if (type != PIZ_SCALE_CUSTOM) {
00421  *      pizSequenceSetScale (sequence, PIZ_KEY_C, PIZ_DORIAN, NULL);
00422  *  } else {
00423  *      pizSequenceSetScale (sequence, PIZ_KEY_C, PIZ_SCALE_CUSTOM, growingArrayPtr);
00424  *  }
00425  * \endcode 
00426  * \warning Custom scales must be twelve values long.
00427  * \ingroup sequenceClass
00428  */
00429 PIZError pizSequenceSetScale (PIZSequence *x, PIZScaleKey key, PIZScaleType type, const PIZGrowingArray *a);
00430

00432  * \brief   Set pattern of the sequence.
00433  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00434  * \param   a The motif.
00435  * \ingroup sequenceClass
00436  */
00437 PIZError pizSequenceSetPattern (PIZSequence *x, const PIZGrowingArray *a);
00438 
00439 /**
00440  * \brief   Test if a note is marked in the sequence.
00441  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00442  * \return  True if a note is marked, otherwise false.  
00443  * \ingroup sequenceBases
00444  */
00445 bool pizSequenceHasMarkedNote (PIZSequence *x);
00446 
00447 /**
00448  * \brief   Get MIDI data of the marked note.
00449  * \remark  The function return -1 in case of error.
00450  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00451  * \param   selector A selector to choose the MIDI data type to query as \ref PIZSelector.
00452  * \return  The MIDI value.  
00453  * \ingroup sequenceBases
00454  */
00455 long pizSequenceMarkedNoteValue (PIZSequence *x, PIZSelector selector);
00456 
00457 /**
00458  * \brief   Change MIDI data of the marked note.
00459  * \remark  Duration is increment (by grid's value) with positive argument (otherwise decrement).
00460  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00461  * \param   selector A selector to choose the MIDI data type to change as \ref PIZSelector.
00462  * \param   value The value to add. 
00463  * \ingroup sequenceBases
00464  */
00465 void pizSequenceChangeMarkedNoteValue (PIZSequence *x, PIZSelector selector, long value);
00466 
00467 /**
00468  * \brief   Clear the sequence.
00469  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00470  * \ingroup sequenceBases
00471  */
00472 void pizSequenceClear (PIZSequence *x);
00473 
00474 /**
00475  * \brief   Get notes splitted in two dynamic arrays according to note's selected state.
00476  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00477  * \param   unselected A pointer to the dynamic array to fill with unselected notes.
00478  * \param   selected A pointer to the dynamic array to fill with selected notes
00479  * \return  An error code.
00480  * \details Notes are appended. The pointer can be NULL. 
00481  *          Notes are transposed according to scale.
00482  * \remark  Examples :
00483  * \code
00484  * err |= pizSequenceNotesToArray (sequence, ptrA, ptrB); 
00485  * err |= pizSequenceNotesToArray (sequence, ptrA, NULL); 
00486  * err |= pizSequenceNotesToArray (sequence, ptrA, ptrA);
00487  * \endcode 
00488  * \ingroup sequenceBases
00489  */
00490 PIZError pizSequenceNotesToArray (PIZSequence *x, PIZGrowingArray *unselected, PIZGrowingArray *selected);
00491 
00492 /**
00493  * \brief   Add notes with a dynamic array.
00494  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00495  * \param   a A pointer to the array.
00496  * \param   flags The flags (as ORed \ref PIZAddFlag).
00497  * \return  An error code.
00498  * \remark  An example :
00499  * \code
00500  * long noteC[PIZ_DATA_NOTE_SIZE];
00501  * long noteG[PIZ_DATA_NOTE_SIZE] = {24, 67, 90, 24, 1, 0, 0}; 
00502  *
00503  * noteC[PIZ_DATA_POSITION]     = 0;
00504  * noteC[PIZ_DATA_PITCH]        = 60;
00505  * noteC[PIZ_DATA_VELOCITY]     = 90;
00506  * noteC[PIZ_DATA_DURATION]     = 24;
00507  * noteC[PIZ_DATA_CHANNEL]      = 0;    // use sequence's global MIDI channel
00508  * noteC[PIZ_DATA_IS_SELECTED]  = 0;
00509  * noteC[PIZ_DATA_IS_MARKED]    = 0;
00510  *
00511  * for (i = 0; i < PIZ_DATA_NOTE_SIZE; i++) {
00512  *      pizGrowingArrayAppend (arrayPtr, noteC[i]);
00513  * }
00514  *
00515  * for (i = 0; i < PIZ_DATA_NOTE_SIZE; i++) {
00516  *      pizGrowingArrayAppend (arrayPtr, noteG[i]);
00517  * }
00518  *
00519  * pizSequenceAddNotesWithArray (sequencePtr, arrayPtr, PIZ_ADD_FLAG_SNAP | PIZ_ADD_FLAG_CLEAR);
00520  *
00521  * \endcode 
00522  * \ingroup sequenceBases
00523  */
00524 PIZError pizSequenceAddNotesWithArray (PIZSequence *x, const PIZGrowingArray *a, long flags);
00525 
00526 /**
00527  * \brief   Get the zone with a dynamic array.
00528  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00529  * \param   a A pointer to the array.
00530  * \return  An error code.
00531  * \ingroup sequenceBases
00532  */
00533 PIZError pizSequenceZoneToArray (PIZSequence *x, PIZGrowingArray *a);
00534 
00535 /**
00536  * \brief   Set the zone with a dynamic array.
00537  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00538  * \param   a A pointer to the array.
00539  * \return  An error code.
00540  * \ingroup sequenceBases
00541  */
00542 PIZError pizSequenceSetZoneWithArray (PIZSequence *x, const PIZGrowingArray *a);
00543 
00544 /**
00545  * \brief   Change the register : transpose the zone and all the notes.
00546  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00547  * \param   n The number of semitones.  
00548  * \ingroup sequenceTransform
00549  */
00550 void pizSequenceTranspose (PIZSequence *x, long n);
00551 
00552 /**
00553  * \brief   Avoid pitch clusters in the sequence.
00554  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00555  * \param   value The interval to keep empty between notes in semitones. 
00556  * \return  True if something changed, otherwise false.  
00557  * \ingroup sequenceTransform
00558  */
00559 bool pizSequenceClean (PIZSequence *x, long value);

00567 long pizSequenceIndex (PIZSequence *x);

00569 /**
00570  * \brief   Test the end of the sequence.
00571  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00572  * \return  True if index is equal to zone's end otherwise false.
00573  * \ingroup sequenceBases

00575 bool pizSequenceIsAtEnd (PIZSequence *x);

00578  * \brief   Set the index to zone's start.
00579  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00580  * \ingroup sequenceBases
00581  */
00582 void pizSequenceGoToStart (PIZSequence *x);
00583 
00584 /**
00585  * \brief   Fill an array with current index's notes and increment it.
00586  * \details Notes are appended.  Return PIZ_ERROR if index is at end. 
00587  *          Notes are transposed according to scale and velocity is modified by global velocity.
00588  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00589  * \param   a A pointer to a dynamic array.
00590  * \return  True if index is equal to zone's end otherwise false.
00591  * \ingroup sequenceBases
00592  */
00593 PIZError pizSequenceProceedStep (PIZSequence *x, PIZGrowingArray *a);
00594 
00595 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00596 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00597 
00598 /**
00599  * \brief   Add a note to the sequence.
00600  * \details The size of the array must be \ref PIZ_DATA_NOTE_SIZE. 
00601  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00602  * \param   values A pointer to note values.
00603  * \param   flags The flags (as ORed \ref PIZAddFlag).
00604  * \return  A pointer to the new note, NULL in case of error.
00605  * \warning For efficiency array size is NOT checked ; so crash may occured with invalid size.
00606  * \ingroup sequencePrivate
00607  */
00608 PIZ_LOCAL PIZNote *pizSequenceAddNote (PIZSequence *x, long *values, long flags);
00609 
00610 /**
00611  * \brief   Remove a note from the sequence. 
00612  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00613  * \param   note A valid pointer.
00614  * \return  An error code.
00615  * \ingroup sequencePrivate
00616  */
00617 PIZ_LOCAL PIZError pizSequenceRemoveNote (PIZSequence *x, PIZNote *note);
00618 
00619 /**
00620  * \brief   Clear the sequence.
00621  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00622  * \ingroup sequencePrivate
00623  */
00624 PIZ_LOCAL void pizSequenceRemoveAllNotes (PIZSequence *x);
00625 
00626 /**
00627  * \brief   Move a note in the sequence.
00628  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00629  * \param   note A valid pointer.
00630  * \param   newPosition The new position;
00631  * \warning For efficiency new position is NOT checked ; so crash may occured with invalid position.
00632  * \ingroup sequencePrivate
00633  */
00634 PIZ_LOCAL void pizSequenceMoveNote (PIZSequence *x, PIZNote *note, long newPosition);
00635 
00636 /**
00637  * \brief   Restore the map after notes have been created, deleted or moved.
00638  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00639  * \remark  For efficiency a list of linked lists currently used is stored in an array ; 
00640  *          this function MUST be called to rebuild the list after modifications on note positions.
00641  * \ingroup sequencePrivate
00642  */
00643 PIZ_LOCAL void pizSequenceMakeMap (PIZSequence *x);
00644 
00645 /**
00646  * \brief   Transpose the pitch to fit the zone's ambitus.
00647  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00648  * \param   pitch The pitch to move.
00649  * \return  The pitch.
00650  * \ingroup sequencePrivate
00651  */
00652 PIZ_LOCAL long pizSequenceMovePitchToAmbitus (PIZSequence *x, long pitch);
00653 
00654 /**
00655  * \brief   Given a position return the new position snapped to the sequence's pattern.
00656  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00657  * \param   pitch The position to be snapped.
00658  * \param   patternSize The size of the sequence's pattern.
00659  * \return  The new position.
00660  * \ingroup sequencePrivate
00661  */
00662 PIZ_LOCAL long pizSequenceSnapPositionToPattern  (PIZSequence *x, long toSnapped, long patternSize);
